definitions.definition: prepare (written material) for publication by correcting, condensing, or otherwise modifying it.
examples: Volume I was edited by J. Johnson
synonyms: put together "this volume was edited by a consultant"

definitions.definition: choose material for (a movie or a radio or television program) and arrange it to form a coherent whole.
examples: the footage wasn't good enough to be edited into broadcast form
synonyms: put together "this volume was edited by a consultant"

definitions.definition: remove unnecessary or inappropriate words, sounds, or scenes from a text, movie, or radio or television program.
be editor of (a newspaper or magazine).
examples: be the editor of, direct, run, manage, head, lead, supervise, oversee, preside over; be the boss of he edited the school newspaper

definitions.definition: a change or correction made as a result of editing.
a version of written, recorded, or filmed material made as a result of editing.
examples: a rough edit of some delightful Javanese gamelan music

definitions.definition: a featured selection of clothes, accessories, beauty products, etc., from a particular season or collection.
examples: this is ELLE’s personal Autumn/Winter 2012 edit
